meanings.definition: A monetary unit equal to one thousandth of a franc in Egypt and Lebanon.
meanings.sent1: In Egypt, you can buy many things with just a few milliemes.
meanings.sent2: She paid for the groceries using milliemes.
meanings.sent3: The vending machine only accepted milliemes, causing a funny mix-up.
meanings.sent4: His savings were just tiny milliemes compared to his friend's.
meanings.sent5: The beggar's cup was filled with shiny milliemes.

meanings.definition: A subdivision of the Egyptian pound, equal to one thousandth of a pound.
meanings.sent1: The price was listed in milliemes on the menu.
meanings.sent2: He exchanged his pounds for milliemes at the bank.
meanings.sent3: The milliemes in his pocket jingled like tiny bells.
meanings.sent4: Her jewelry sparkled like precious milliemes under the light.
meanings.sent5: The child's piggy bank was full of colorful milliemes.
